fields.question_html:
The mean of p, q and r is same as the mean of q, 2r and s. Then which of the following is correct?

(a) p = q = r              (b) q = r = s                     (c) q = r                           (d) p = r + s
fields.solution_html:
Mean of p, q and r = Mean of q, 2r and s
p+q+r3=q+2r+s3⇒p+q+r=q+2r+s⇒p=r+s
Hence, the correct option is (d).

fields.question_html:
The area of a rhombus is 119 cm2 and its perimeter is 56 cm. The height of the rhombus is

(a) 7.5 cm                     (b) 6.5 cm                         (c) 8.5 cm                (d) 9.5 cm
fields.solution_html:
Let b the side of the rhombus and h be its height.
Perimeter of rhombus = 56 cm
⇒4b=56⇒b=14 cm
Now
Area of rhombus = 119 cm2
⇒b×h=119⇒14×h=119⇒h=172=8.5 cm
Hence, the correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
The ratio of the area and circumference of a circle of diameter d is

(a) d                              (b) d2                               (c) d4                               (d) 2d
fields.solution_html:
Let r and d be respectively the radius and diameter of the circle. Then
d = 2r
Circumference of circle = 2πr = 2π×d2=πd
Area of circle = πr2 = πd22=πd24
Now
Area of circleCircumference of circle=πd24πd=d4
Hence, the correct option is (c)

fields.question_html:
A circle is inscribed in a square of side 14 m.  The ratio of the area of the circle and that of
the square is

(a) π : 3                       (b) π : 4                           (c) π : 2                           (d) π : 1
fields.solution_html:
Let a and r be the side of the square and radius of the circle respectively.
Here, the diameter of the circle is equal to the side of the square. So
Diameter of circle = 2r = a
Therefore
Area of circleArea of square=πr2a2=π×r22r2=π4
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
If the mean of observations 20, 42, 35, 45 and x is 37, then x =

(a) 43                                    (b) 42                                (c) 44                                 (d) 45
fields.solution_html:
Given : the mean of the observations 20, 42, 35, 45 and x.
Mean of observations=Sum of observationsNumber of observations⇒37=20+42+35+45+x5⇒142+x=185⇒x=185-142=43
Thus, the value of x is 43.
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
The mean of first six multiples of 5 is

(a) 3.5                                 (b) 18.5                               (c) 17.5                                 (d) 30
fields.solution_html:
The first six multiples of 5 are: 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30.
Mean=Sum of observationsNumber of observations          =5+10+15+20+25+306          =1056          =17.5
Thus, the mean of first six multiples of 5 is 17.5.
Hence, the correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
How many times should a wheel of radius 7 m rotate to go around the perimeter
of a rectangular field of length 60 m and breadth 50 m?

(a) 3                       (b) 4                           (c) 5                           (d) 6
fields.solution_html:
Here, Radius (r) = 7 m, Length (l) = 60 m and Breadth (b) = 50 m.
Perimeter of circle = 2πr=2×227×7=44 m
Perimeter of rectangle = 2l+b=260+50=220 m
Therefore
Number of turns = Perimeter of rectanglePerimeter of circle=22044=5
Hence, the correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
The cost of fencing a semi-circular garden of radius 14 m at ₹10 per metre is 

(a) ₹1080                   (b) ₹1020                       (c) ₹700                        (d) ₹720
fields.solution_html:
Radius of circle (r) = 14 m
Perimeter of semi-circular garden
   =πr+2r=227×14+2×14=44+28=72 m
Cost of fencing = 72 × ₹10 = ₹720
Hence, the correct option is (d).

fields.question_html:
If the sum of 10 observations is 95, then their mean is

(a) 9.5                                 (b) 10                               (c) 950                                 (d) 95
fields.solution_html:
Sum of 10 observations = 95
Mean=Sum of observationsNumber of observations          =9510          =9.5
Thus, the mean is 9.5.
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
The mean of five numbers is 4. If 1 is added to each other, then the new mean is

(a) 4                                 (b) 5                               (c) 3                                 (d) 5.5
fields.solution_html:
Mean of five numbers = 4
Sum of five numbers = 5 × 4 = 20
New mean=Sum of observationsNumber of observations          =20+1+1+1+1+15          =255          =5
Thus, the new mean is 5.
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
The mode of the unimodular data 7, 8, 9, 8, 9, 10, 9, 10, 11, 10, 11, 12 and x is 10.
The value of x is

(a) 10                           (b) 9                                 (c) 8                                   (d) 11
fields.solution_html:
Arranging the data in ascending order, we get
7, 8, 8, 9, 9, 9, 10, 10, 10, 10, 11, 11, 12
Here, 10 has the maximum frequency (4).
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
The area of a square is equal to the area of a circle. The ratio between the side of the square
and the radius of the circle is

(a) π : 1               (b) 1 : π                       (c) 1 : π                  (d) π : 1
fields.solution_html:
Let a and r be respectively the side of the square and radius of the circle.
Here, the area of square is equal to the area of the circle. So
                                                      a2=πr2⇒a2r2=π⇒ar=π
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
If A is the area and C be the circumference of a circle, then its radius is
(a) AC                (b) 2AC                       (c) 3AC                  (d) 4AC
fields.solution_html:
Let r be the radius of the circle. Then
A=πr2 and C=2πr⇒AC=πr22πr⇒AC=r2⇒r=2AC
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
The median of the data 9, 12, 11, 10, 8, 9, 11 is

(a) 10                                 (b) 11                               (c) 9                                 (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
Arranging the given data in increasing order, we get
8, 9, 9, 10, 11, 11, 12
As the number of observations is odd (7), the median is the middle term which is 10.
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
The circumferences of two circles are in the ratio 3 : 4. The ratio of their areas is

(a) 3 : 4                        (b) 4 : 3                       (c) 9 : 16                          (d) 16 : 9
fields.solution_html:
Let r1 and r2 be the radius of the two circles. Then
2πr12πr2=34⇒r1r2=34
Now
Ratio of areas=πr12πr22=r1r22=342=916
Thus, the required ratio is 9 : 16.
Hence, the correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
The mean of a data is 15 and the sum of the observations is 195. The number of observations is

(a) 13                                 (b) 19                               (c) 16                                 (d) 17
fields.solution_html:
Mean of data = 15
Sum of observations = 195
Mean=Sum of observationsNumber of observationsn⇒15=195n⇒n=19515=13
Thus, the number of observations is 13.
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
The mean weight of 21 students is 21 kg. If a student weighing 21 kg is removed from the group,
then the mean of of the remaining students is

(a) 20 kg                       (b) 21 kg                         (c) 19 kg                         (d) 18 kg
fields.solution_html:
Mean weight = 21 kg
Number of students = 21
Sum of weights of 21 students = 21 × 21 = 441
Sum of weights of 20 students left = 441 − 21 = 420
Mean of remaining students = 42020=21 kg
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
There are 7 observations in the data and their mean is 11. If each observation is multiplied by
2, then the mean of new observations is

(a) 11                       (b) 13                         (c) 22                         (d) 55
fields.solution_html:
Mean = 11
Number of observations = 7
Sum of observations = 11 × 7 = 77
Sum of new observations = 2 × 77 = 154
Mean of new observations = 1547=22
Hence, the correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
The median of the data 5, 7, 9, 10, 11 is

(a) 7                                 (b) 9                               (c) 11                                 (d) 10
fields.solution_html:
The data in arranging order is : 5, 7, 9, 10, 11
As the number of observations is odd (5), the median is the middle term which is 9.
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
The mean of 10 observations is 15. If one observation 15 is added, then the new mean is

(a) 16                       (b) 11                         (c) 10                         (d) 15
fields.solution_html:
Sum of 10 observations = 10 × 15 = 150
Sum of 11 observations = 150 + 15 = 165
Number observations = 11
Mean of 11 observations = 16511=15
Thus, the new mean is 15.
Hence, the correct option is (d).

fields.question_html:
If area of an equilateral triangle is 33 cm2, then its height is
(a) 3 cm                 (b) 3 cm                    (c) 6 cm                (d) 23 cm
fields.solution_html:
Let a and h be respectively the side and height of the equilateral triangle. Then
a234=12×a×h⇒a34=12×h⇒a=2h3
Therefore
Area of equilateral triangle =12×a×h⇒33=12×2h3×h⇒h2=9⇒h=3 cm
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
The area of a rhombus is 144 cm2 and one of its diagonals is double the other. The length of the
longer diagonal is

(a) 12 cm                 (b) 16 cm                    (c) 18 cm                (d) 24 cm
fields.solution_html:
Let d1 and d2 be the diagonals of the rhombus, where d1 = 2d2.
Area of rhombus=12×d1×d2⇒144=12×d1×d12                         ∵ d1=2d2⇒d12=4×144⇒d1=2×12=24 cm
Hence, the correct option is (d).

fields.question_html:
A dice is tossed 80 times and number 5 is obtained 14 times. The probability of not getting the number 5 is

(a) 740                                         (b) 780                                      (c) 3340                                             (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
Probability of getting 5 = 1480=740
Therefore
Probability of not getting 5 = 1-740=3340
Hence, the correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
The difference between the circumference and radius of a circle is 37 cm. The area of the circle is

(a) 111 cm2                        (b) 148 cm2                       (c) 154 cm2                          (d) 258 cm2
fields.solution_html:
Let r1 and r2 be the radius of the two circles. Then
2πr-r=37⇒2×227×r-r=37⇒44r-7r7=37⇒r=37×737=7 cm
Now
Area of circle=πr2=227×7×7=154 cm2
Hence, the correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
An unbiased coin is tossed once, the probability of getting head is

(a) 12                                  (b) 1                                         (c) 13                                  (d) 14
fields.solution_html:
Tossing a coin, either we get a head (H) or a tail (T). So, the probability of getting a head is 12.
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
When a dice is thrown, the total number of possible outcomes is

(a) 6                                         (b) 1                                          (c) 3                                             (d) 4
fields.solution_html:
The number on the faces of a dice are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6.
∴ Number of possible outcomes = 6
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
There are 100 cards numbered from 1 to 100 in a box. If a card is drawn from the box and
the probability of an event is 12, then the number of favourable cases to the event is

(a) 20                                         (b) 25                                          (c) 40                                             (d) 50
fields.solution_html:
Here, 50100=12.
So, if the the probability of an event is 12, then the number of favourable cases has to be 50.
Hence, the correct option is (d).

fields.question_html:
A coin is tossed 100 times and head is obtained 59 times. The probability of getting a tail is

(a) 59100                                         (b) 41100                                      (c) 29100                                             (d) 43100
fields.solution_html:
Number of all possible outcomes = 100
Number of head obtained = 59
Number of tail obtained (favourable outcomes) = 100 − 59 = 41
Therefore
Probability of getting a tail = 41100
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
A bag contains 4 green balls, 4 red balls and 2 blue balls. If a ball is drawn from the bag, the
probability of getting neither green nor red ball is

(a) 25                                         (b) 12                                      (c) 45                                             (d) 15
fields.solution_html:
The probability of getting neither green nor red ball is equal to the probability of getting blue balls.
Number of blue balls = 2
Total number of balls = 4 + 4 + 2 = 10
Therefore
Probability of getting neither green nor red ball = 210=15
Hence, the correct option is (d).

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
0.23 × 0.3 = ?

(a) 0.69
(b) 6.9
(c) 0.069
(d) none of these
fields.solution_html:
(c) 0.069
First, we will multiply 23 by 3.
i.e., 23 × 3 = 69
Sum of decimal places in the given decimals  = (2 + 1) = 3
∴ 0.23 × 0.3 = 0.069     ( 3 places of decimal)

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
0.02 × 30 = ?

(a) 6
(b) 0.6
(c) 0.06
(d) none of these
fields.solution_html:
(b) 0.6
We have:
2 × 30 = 60
∴ 0.02 × 30 = 0.60            (2 places of decimal)
                        = 0.6

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

234=a 243                                    b 234                                    c 243                                    d None of these
fields.solution_html:
Since,

234=23×4                        As, xmn=xmn=24×3=243                        As, xmn=xmn

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If a fraction ab is a lowest terms, then HCF of a and b is

(a) a                                       (b) b                                       (c) 1                                       (d) ab
fields.solution_html:
We know that a fraction is in its lowest terms if its numerator and denominator have no common factor other than 1.

Thus, if the fraction ab is in its lowest terms, then the HCF of a and b is 1.

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following is a vulgar fraction?

(a) 710                                       (b) 131000                                       (c) 2910                                       (d) 79
fields.solution_html:
The fractions with denominator not equal to 10, 100, 1000 etc are called vulgar fractions.

Thus, the fraction 79 is a vulgar fraction.

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.question_html:
The area of a circle of circumference C is

(a) C24π                (b) C22π                       (c) C2π                  (d) 4C2π
fields.solution_html:
Let r be the radius of the circle. Then
C=2πr ⇒r=C2π
Therefore
Area of circle = πr2=πC2π2=C24π
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

413-213=

(a) 213                                      (b) 2                                       (c) 313                                      (d) 12
fields.solution_html:
413-213=133-73=13-73=63=2

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

The fraction equivalent to 123 is

(a) 103                                      (b) 35                                       (c) 106                                      (d) 610
fields.solution_html:
The given fraction is 123=53.

We know that if ab and cd are two equivalent fractions, then

a×d=b×c 

Now,

5×6=3×10

So, the fractions 53 and 106 are equivalent fractions.

Thus, the fraction equivalent to 123 is 106.

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

514-313=

(a) 1223                                      (b) 2                                       (c) 11112                                      (d) 1112
fields.solution_html:
514-313=214-103=21×34×3-10×43×4                        LCM of 3 and 4 is 12=6312-4012
=63-4012=2312=11112

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

By what number 435 be multiplied to get 237?

(a) 39135                                      (b) 8591                                       (c) 9185                                      (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
Product of two numbers = 237=177

One of the numbers = 435=235

∴ Other number = Product of two numbers ÷ One of the numbers

                          =177÷235=177×523=17×57×23=85161

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.question_html:
The area of a circle is 9π cm2. Its circumference is

(a) 6π cm                        (b) 36π cm                       (c) 9π cm                  (d) 36π2 cm
fields.solution_html:
Let r be the radius of the circle. Then
Area of circle = 9π cm2
⇒πr2=9π  ⇒ r=3 cm
Therefore
Circumference of the circle = 2πr=2π×3=6π cm
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which one of the following is true?

(a) 12<913<34<1217                                                     (b) 34<913<12<1217                                      

(c) 12<34<913<1217                                                     (d) 12<913<1217<34
fields.solution_html:
Consider the fractions 12, 913, 34 and 1217.

LCM of 2, 4, 13 and 17 = 884

Firstly, convert the fractions into equivalent fractions with denominator 884.

12=1×4422×442=442884913=9×6813×68=61288434=3×2214×221=6638841217=12×5217×52=624884

Now,

442 < 612 < 624 < 663

∴442884<612884<624884<663884⇒12<913<1217<34

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.question_html:
The area of a circle is increased by 22 cm2 when its radius is increased by 1 cm.
The original radius of the circle is

(a) 6 cm                        (b) 3 cm                       (c) 4 cm                  (d) 3.5 cm
fields.solution_html:
Let r be the radius of the circle. Then
Area of original circle = πr2 cm2
Radius of circle after increment = (r + 1) cm
Thus,as per the question
πr+12-πr2=22⇒r+12-r2=22227=7⇒r2+2r+1-r2=7⇒r=3 cm
Thus, the original radius of the circle is 3 cm.
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
The radii of two circles are in the ratio 2 : 3. The ratio of their areas is

(a) 2 : 3                        (b) 4 : 9                       (c) 3 : 2                          (d) 9 : 4
fields.solution_html:
Let r1 and r2 be the radius of the two circles. So
r1r2=23
Now
Ratio of areas=πr12πr22=r1r22=232=49
Thus, the required ratio is 4 : 9.
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
The mean of first seven even natural numbers is

(a) 7                                 (b) 8                               (c) 9                                 (d) 6
fields.solution_html:
The first seven even natural numbers are: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14.
Mean=Sum of observationsNumber of observations          =2+4+6+8+10+12+147          =567          =8
Thus, the mean of first seven even natural numbers is 8.
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
If the mean of n observations is 12 and the sum of the observations is 132, then the value of n is

(a) 9                                 (b) 10                               (c) 11                                 (d) 12
fields.solution_html:
Mean of n observations = 12
Sum of observations = 132
Mean=Sum of observationsNumber of observations⇒12=132n⇒n=13212=11
Thus, the value of n is 11.
Hence, the correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
The mean of 10, 15, 19, 30, 43, 69 and x is x. Then the median is

(a) 19                           (b) 43                                 (c) 30                                   (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
The mean of 10, 15, 19, 30, 43, 69 and x is x.
∴ Mean=Sum of observationsNumber of observations⇒x=10+15+19+30+43+69+x7⇒x+186=7x⇒x=1866=31
Thus, the observations are 10, 15, 19, 30, 43, 69 and 31.
Arranging the numbers 10, 15, 19, 30, 43, 69 and 31 in increasing order, we get
10, 15, 19, 30, 31, 43, 69
Thus, the median is 30.
Hence, the correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
If the mean of 9, 10, 15, x, 6, 8 and 12 is 11. The median of the observations is

(a) 4                           (b) 10                                 (c) 13                                   (d) 5
fields.solution_html:
The mean of 9, 10, 15, x, 6, 8 and 12 is 11.
∴ Mean=Sum of observationsNumber of observations⇒11=9+10+15+x+6+8+127⇒x+60=77⇒x=77-60=17
So, the observations are 9, 10, 15, 17, 6, 8 and 12.
Arranging the the observations in increasing order, we get
9, 10, 15, 17, 6, 8, 12        or           6, 8, 9, 10, 12, 15, 17
Thus, the median is 10.
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

0.3 × 0.3 × 0.3 =

(a) 2.7                                         (b) 0.27                                         (c) 0.027                                         (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
We have,

3 × 3 × 3 = 27

The sum of the decimal places in the given decimals is 1 + 1 + 1 = 3.

So, the product must contain 3 places of decimals.

∴ 0.3 × 0.3 × 0.3 = 0.027

Hence, the correct answer is (c).

fields.question_html:

0.25 × 0.8 = ?

(a) 0.02
(b) 0.2
(c) 0.002
(d) 2
fields.solution_html:
(b) 0.2
First, we will multiply 25 by 8.
∴ 25 × 8 = 200
Sum of decimal places in the given decimals = (2 + 1) = 3
∴ 0.25 × 0.8 = 0.200    [3 places of decimal]
                        = 0.2

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

5 kg 5 g written in decimal notation is

(a) 5.5 kg                             (b) 5.05 kg                             (c) 5.005 kg                             (d) 5.0005 kg

Disclaimer: The units are missing from the options given in the book.
fields.solution_html:
We know that,

1 g = 11000 kg

Now,

5 kg 5 g = 5 kg + 5 g

              = 5 kg + 51000 kg

              = 5 kg + 0.005 kg

              = 5.005 kg

∴ 5 kg 5 g = 5.005 kg

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

4 + 4.4 + 44.4 + 4.04 + 444 =

(a) 500.88                                         (b) 577.2                                         (c) 495.22                                         (d) 472.88
fields.solution_html:
Converting the decimals to like decimals, we have 4.00, 4.40, 44.40, 4.04 and 444.00.

Now,
 
      4 . 0 0
      4 . 4 0
    4 4 . 4 0
      4 . 0 4
+ 4 4 4 . 0 0
  5 0 0 . 8 4

∴ 4 + 4.4 + 44.4 + 4.04 + 444 = 500.84

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

0.012 × 0.15 =  

(a) 0.8                           (b) 0.08                          (c) 0.008                         (d) 0.0018
fields.solution_html:
We have,

12 × 15 = 180

It can be seen that the sum of the decimals in the given decimals is 3 + 2 = 5.

So, the product must contain 5 places of decimals.

∴ 0.012 × 0.15 = 0.00180 = 0.0018

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

5 km 5 m = ?

(a) 5.5 km                         (b) 5.05 km                         (c) 5.005 km                         (d) 5.0005 km
fields.solution_html:
We know that,

1 m = 11000 km

Now,

5 km 5 m = 5 km + 5 m

              = 5 km + 51000 km

              = 5 km + 0.005 km

              = 5.005 km

∴ 5 km 5 m = 5.005 km

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
A dice is rolled. The probability of getting an even prime is

(a) 16                                  (b) 13                                         (c) 12                                  (d) 56
fields.solution_html:
The possible numbers on a dice are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6.
There is only one even prime number which is 2.
∴ Probability of getting an even prime = Number of even prime numbersNumber of all possible outcomes on the dice=16

                                                                            
Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

The value of 2.2 × 0.2 × 0.001 is

(a) 4.2                                         (b) 0.00044                                        (c) 4.4                                         (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
In order to find the product, we first multiply 22 by 2.

We have, 22 × 2 = 44

Now, 2.2 has 1 decimal place, 0.2 has 1 decimal place and 0.001 has 3 decimal places.

The sum of the decimal places is 1 + 1 + 3 = 5.

So, the product must contain 5 places of decimals.

∴ 2.2 × 0.2 × 0.001 = 0.00044

Thus, the value of 2.2 × 0.2 × 0.001 is 0.00044.

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
There are 10 marbles in a box which are marked with the distinct numbers from 1 to 10.
A marble is drawn randomly. The probability of getting prime numbered marble is

(a) 12                                         (b) 25                                          (c) 93                                             (d) 310
fields.solution_html:
The numbers marked on the marbles are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10.
Here, the prime numbers (favourable outcomes) are 2, 3, 5, and 7.
∴ Number of favourable outcomes = 4
Therefore
Probability of getting prime numbered marble = 410=25
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

8 ml is equal to

(a) 0.8 l                                         (b) 0.08 l                                         (c) 0.008 l                                         (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
We know that,

1 mL = 11000 L

∴ 8 mL = 81000 L = 0.008 L

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If 14 × 4 = 56, then 0.014 × 4 =

(a) 0.56                                         (b) 5.6                                         (c) 0.056                                         (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
It is given that,

14 × 4 = 56

Now, 0.014 has 3 decimal places.

So, the required product must contain 3 places of decimals.

∴ 0.014 × 4 = 0.056

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

A ratio equivalent to 2 : 5 is

(a) 6 : 15                             (b) 4 : 5                             (c) 5 : 2                             (d) 5 : 4
fields.solution_html:
Since, 2:5=25=2×35×3=615=6:15

So, the ratio equivalent to 2 : 5 is 6 : 15.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If -37=x35, then x =

(a) 15                                 (b) 21                                 (c) −15                                  (d) −21
fields.solution_html:
Firstly, write -37 as a rational number with denominator 35.

Multiplying the numerator and denominator of -37 by 5, we have

-37=-3×57×5=-1535

∴-37=x35⇒-1535=x35⇒x=-15

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
On reducing the value of a chair by 6% it becomes Rs 658. The original value of the chair is

(a) Rs 750
(b) Rs 720
(c) Rs 500
(d) Rs 700
fields.solution_html:
(d) Rs. 700
Let us assume that the original price of the chair is Rs x.
Reduce percentage on the chair = 6%
So, value of reduction on the chair = 6% of Rs. x
                                                        = Rs 6100×x = Rs 3x50
Reduced price of the chair = Rs x-3x50
                                            = Rs 50x-3x50 = Rs 47x50
However, present price of the chair = Rs 658
Then, Rs 47x50 = Rs 658
⇒ Rs 47x50 = Rs 658
⇒ x = Rs 658×5047 = Rs 14×50=700
Hence, the original price of the chair is Rs 700

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following fractions lies between 23 and 57?

(a) 34                                      (b) 45                                       (c) 56                                      (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
Consider the fractions 23, 57, 34, 45 and 56.

LCM of 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 = 420

Firstly, convert the fractions into equivalent fractions with denominator 420.

23=2×1403×140=28042057=5×607×60=30042034=3×1054×105=31542045=4×845×84=33642056=5×706×70=350420

Now,

280 < 300 < 315 < 336 < 350

∴280420<300420<315420<336420<350420⇒23<57<34<45<56

Thus, none of the fractions 34, 45, 56 lies between the fractions 23 and 57.

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
0.4 × 0.4 × 0.4 = ?

(a) 6.4
(b) .64
(c) .064
(d) none of these
fields.solution_html:
(c) .064

First, we will find the product 4 × 4 × 4 = 64
Sum of decimal places in the given decimals = (1 + 1 + 1) = 3
∴ 0.4 × 0.4 × 0.4 = 0.064   ( 3 places of decimal)

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If the rational numbers -23 and 4x represent a pair of equivalent rational numbers, then x =

(a) 6                                 (b) −6                                 (c) 3                                 (d) −3
fields.solution_html:
It is given that the rational numbers -23 and 4x represent a pair of equivalent rational numbers.

We know that the values of two equivalent rational numbers is equal. 

∴-23=4x⇒-2×x=4×3                     ab=cd⇒ad=bc⇒-2x=12⇒-2x-2=12-2                       Dividing both sides by -2⇒x=-6

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following is correct?

(a) 23<35<1115                  (b) 35<23<1115                  (c) 1115<35<23                  (d) 35<1115<23
fields.solution_html:
Consider the fractions 23, 35 and 1115.

LCM of 3, 5 and 15 = 15

Firstly, convert the fractions into equivalent fractions with denominator 15.

23=2×53×5=101535=3×35×3=915

Now,

9 < 10 < 11

∴915<1015<1115⇒35<23<1115

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

What is the multiplicative identity element in the set of whole numbers?

(a) 0                                 (b) 1                                 (c) −1                                 (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
We know that if a is a whole number, then a × 1 = a = 1 × a.

Therefore, 1 is the multiplicative identity element for multiplication of whole numbers because it does not change the identity or value of the whole number during the operation of multiplication.

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which is the smallest of the following fractions?

(a) 49                                 (b) 25                                 (c) 37                                  (d) 14
fields.solution_html:
Consider the fractions 49, 25, 37 and 14.

LCM of 4, 5, 7 and 9 = 1260

Firstly, convert the fractions into equivalent fractions with denominator 1260.

49=4×1409×140=560126025=2×2525×252=504126037=3×1807×180=540126014=1×3154×315=3151260

Now,

315 < 504 < 540 < 560

∴3151260<5041260<5401260<5601260⇒14<25<37<49

Thus, the smallest fraction is 14.

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

What is the additive identity element in the set of whole numbers?

(a) 0                                 (b) 1                                 (c) −1                                 (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
If a is a whole number then a + 0 = a = 0 + a.

Therefore, 0 is the additive identity element for addition of whole number because it does not change the identity or value of the whole number during the operation of addition.

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following fractions is more than one-third?

(a) 2370                               (b) 205819                               (c) 2675                               (d) 118335
fields.solution_html:
Let ab and cd be two fractions. Then, ab>cd if a×d>b×c.

Consider the fractions 2370 and 13.
23×3=691×70=70∴23×3<1×70⇒2370<13

Consider the fractions 205819 and 13.
205×3=6151×819=819∴205×3<1×819⇒205819<13

Consider the fractions 2675 and 13.
26×3=781×75=75∴26×3>1×75⇒2675>13

Consider the fractions 118335 and 13.
118×3=3541×335=335∴118×3>1×335⇒118335>13

Thus, the fractions 2675 and 118335 are more than the fraction 13.

Hence, the correct answers are options (c) and (d).


Disclaimer: There are two correct options in the question. One of the two options among (c) and (d) must be changed accordingly to get only one correct answer.

fields.question_html:
If the mean of observations 7, 8, 9, 11 and x is 10, then x =

(a) 10                                    (b) 15                                (c) 12                                 (d) 13
fields.solution_html:
Given : the mean of the observations 7, 8, 9, 11 and x is 10.
Mean of observations=Sum of observationsNumber of observations⇒10=7+8+9+11+x5⇒35+x=50⇒x=50-35=15
Thus, the value of x is 15.
Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
The mean of first five natural numbers is

(a) 5                                    (b) 4                                (c) 3                                 (d) 6
fields.solution_html:
The first five natural numbers are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.
Mean=Sum of observationsNumber of observations          =1+2+3+4+55          =155          =3
Thus, the mean of first five natural number is 3.
Hence, the correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
Food chains are simple representations of .................... in nature.

(a) energy flow
(b) rain
(c) snow
(d) pyramids
fields.solution_html:
(a) energy flow

Food chains are simple representations of energy flow in nature.

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following is a proper fraction?

(a) 1317                                       (b) 1713                                       (c) 125                                       (d) 134
fields.solution_html:
A fraction whose numerator is less than the denominator is called a proper fraction.

The numerator in each of the fractions 1713, 125, 134=74 is more than the denominator, so these fractions are improper fractions.

The numerator of the fraction 1317 is less than the denominator, so this fraction is a proper fraction.

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

The reciprocal of the fraction 235 is

(a) 253                                       (b) 135                                       (c) 513                                       (d) 225
fields.solution_html:
The reciprocal of a non-zero fraction ab is the fraction ba.

235=2×5+35=135

Now,

Reciprocal of the fraction 135 = 513

∴ Reciprocal of the fraction 235 = 513

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

By what number should 134 be divided to get 212?

(a) 37                                      (b) 125                                       (c) 710                                      (d) 137
fields.solution_html:
Let the required number be x.

Now,

134÷x=212⇒74×1x=52⇒x=74×25⇒x=7×12×5⇒x=710

Thus, the required number is 710.

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

By what number 945 be multiplied to get 42?

(a) 307                                      (b) 730                                       (c) 417                                      (d) 437
fields.solution_html:
Product of two numbers = 42

One of the numbers = 945=495

∴ Other number = Product of two numbers ÷ One of the numbers

                          =42÷495=421×549=6×51×7=307

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following statements is true?

(a) 712<421                                      (b) 712=421                                       (c) 712>421                                      (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
Consider the fractions 712 and 421.

Prime factorisation of 12 = 2 × 2 × 3

Prime factorisation of 21 = 3 × 7

∴ LCM of 12 and 21 = 2 × 2 × 3 × 7 = 84

Firstly, convert the fractions to equivalent fractions with denominator 84.

712=7×712×7=4984421=4×421×4=1684

Now,

49 > 16

∴4984>1684⇒712>421

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

The smallest of the fractions 23,47,811 and 59 is

(a) 23                                      (b) 47                                       (c) 811                                      (d) 59
fields.solution_html:
The given fractions are 23,47,811 and 59.

LCM of 3, 7, 9 and 11 = 693

Firstly, convert the fractions into equivalent fractions with denominator 693.

23=2×2313×231=46269347=4×997×99=396693811=8×6311×63=50469359=5×779×77=385693

Now,

385 < 396 < 462 < 504

∴385693<396693<462693<504693⇒59<47<23<811

Thus, the smallest of the given fractions is 59.

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

9×-13×-3×-19=

(a) 1                                      (b) −1                                       (c) −3                                      (d) 3
fields.solution_html:
Since the number of negative terms in the product is odd. Therefore, their product is negative.

9×-13×-3×-19=9×-19×-13×-3=-9×19×13×3=-1×1=-1

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

What should be subtracted from -23 to get 45?

(a) 2215                                 (b) -2215                                 (c) 1522                                 (d) -1522
fields.solution_html:
Difference of the given number and required number = 45

Given number = -23

∴ Required number = Given number − Difference of the numbers

                               =-23-45=-23+-45=-2×5+-4×315=-10+-1215=-2215

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

What should be added to -79 to get 2?

(a) 119                                 (b) -119                                 (c) -259                                 (d) 259
fields.solution_html:
Sum of the given number and the required number = 2

Given number = -79

∴ Required number = Sum of the numbers − Given number

                              =2--79=21+79=2×9+7×19=18+79=259

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

-513+?=-1

(a) 813                                 (b) -813                                 (c) -1813                                 (d) 1813
fields.solution_html:
-513+?=-1⇒?=-1--513⇒?=-1+513                               --513=513⇒?=-1×13+513
⇒?=-13+513⇒?=-813

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If x2+13=1, then x =

(a) 34                                   (b) 43                                   (c) -34                                   (d) -43
fields.solution_html:
x2+13=1⇒x2=1-13⇒x2=3×1-13⇒x2=3-13⇒x2=23
⇒2x2=2×23                       Multiplying both sides by 2⇒x=43

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

-713--815=

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

The difference between the greatest and the least fractions out of 67,78,89 and 910 is

(a) 310                            (b) 156                             (c) 140                            (d) 172
fields.solution_html:
Consider the fractions 67,78,89  and 910.

LCM of 7, 8, 9 and 10 = 2520

Firstly, convert the fractions into equivalent fractions with denominator 2520.

67=6×3607×360=2160252078=7×3158×315=2205252089=8×2809×280=22402520910=9×25210×252=22682520

Now,

2160 < 2205 < 2240 < 2268

∴21602520<22052520<22402520<22682520⇒67<78<89<910

So,

Greatest fraction = 910

Least fraction = 67

∴ Required difference

=910-67=22682520-21602520=2268-21602520=1082520

=108÷362520÷36                  HCF of 108 and 2520=36=370


Disclaimer: None of the options given in the question matches with the answer.

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following fractions is greater than 34 and less than 56?

(a) 23                               (b) 12                               (c) 45                               (d) 910
fields.solution_html:
Consider the fractions 34,56,23,12,45 and 910.

LCM of 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 10 = 60

Firstly, convert the fractions into equivalent fractions with denominator 60.

34=3×154×15=456056=5×106×10=506023=2×203×20=406012=1×302×30=306045=4×125×12=4860910=9×610×6=5460

Now,

30 < 40 < 45 < 48 < 50 < 54

∴3060<4060<4560<4860<5060<5460⇒12<23<34<45<56<910

Thus, the fraction 45 is greater than 34 and less than 56.

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following pairs of rational numbers are on the opposite side of the zero on the number line?

(a) 37 and 512                                 (b) -37 and -512                                 (c) 37 and -512                                 (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
The rational numbers 37 and 512 are positive rational numbers. We know that every positive rational number is greater than 0, so both the rational numbers 37 and 512 are represented by points on the right of the zero on the number line.

The rational numbers -37 and -512 are negative rational numbers. We know that every negative rational number is less than 0, so both the rational numbers 37 and 512 are represented by points on the left of the zero on the number line.

The rational numbers 37 is a positive rational number whereas the rational number -512 is a negative rational numbers. We know that every negative rational number is less than 0 and every positive rational number is greater than 0, so the rational number 37 is represented by point on the right of the zero and -512 is represented by point on the left of the zero on the number line.
Thus, the rational numbers 37 and -512 are on the opposite side of the zero on the number line.

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

What should be added to 5.09 to get 5.5?

(a) 0.41                                         (b) 0.59                                         (c) 0.49                                         (d) 0.95
fields.solution_html:
The decimal number which should be added to 5.09 to get 5.5 is obtained by subtracting 5.09 from 5.5.

Converting the given decimals to like decimals, we have 5.09 and 5.50.

Now,

5.50-5.090.41

∴ Required decimal = 5.50 − 5.09 = 0.41

Thus, 0.41 must be added to 5.09 to get 5.5.

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

0.25 × 0.8 =

(a) 0.02                                        (b) 0.2                                        (c) 0.002                                         (d) 2
fields.solution_html:
In order to find the product, we first multiply 8 by 25.

We have, 25 × 8 = 200

Now, 0.25 has 2 decimal places and 0.8 has 1 decimal place.

The sum of the decimal places is 2 + 1 = 3.

So, the product must contain 3 places of decimals.

∴ 0.25 × 0.8 = 0.200 = 0.2

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

(a) 0.8                                         (b) 0.08                                         (c) 0.008                                         (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
0.012÷1.5=0.0121.5=0.012×101.5×10          Multiply the numerator and denominator by 10 to convert the divisor into a whole number=0.1215


∴ 0.012 ÷ 1.5 = 0.008

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

0.02 × 0.05 =

(a) 0.1                                        (b) 0.01                                        (c) 0.001                                         (d) 0.0001
fields.solution_html:
In order to find the product, we first multiply 2 by 5.

We have, 2 × 5 = 10

Now, 0.02 has 2 decimal places and 0.05 has 2 decimal places.

The sum of the decimal places is 2 + 2 = 4.

So, the product must contain 4 places of decimals.

∴ 0.02 × 0.05 = 0.0010 = 0.001

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

When 0.48 is written in the simplest form of its terms, the sum of its numerator and denominator is

(a) 148                                         (b) 74                                         (c) 37                                         (d) 147
fields.solution_html:
0.48=48100        =48÷4100÷4                    HCF of 48 and 100=4        =1225

Here,

Numerator = 12

Denominator = 25

∴ Sum of the numerator and denominator = 12 + 25 = 37

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

(a) 6
(b) 7
(c) 12
(d) 11
fields.solution_html:
(b) 7

Suppose that x is the number that is to be added.

Then, (3 + x) : (5 + x) = 5 : 6

⇒3 +x5 + x= 56⇒18 + 6x = 25+ 5x⇒x =7

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
What least number is to be subtracted from each term of the ratio 15 : 19 to make the ratio 3 : 4?

(a) 3
(b) 5
(c) 6
(d) 9
fields.solution_html:
(a)  3
Suppose that x is the number that is to be subtracted.
Then, (15 − x) : (19 − x) = 3 : 4

⇒15 - x19- x=34Cross multiplying, we get:60 - 4x = 57 - 3x⇒x = 3

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

Which of the following is not a monomial?

(a) 2x2 + 1                           (b) 3x4                           (c) ab                           (d) x2y
fields.solution_html:
Since, 2x2 + 1 has two terms 2x2 and 1.

So, 2x2 + 1 is a binomial.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

The sum of the coefficients in the monomials 3a2b and -2ab2 is

(a) 5                           (b) -1                           (c) 1                           (d) 6
fields.solution_html:
Since, the coefficient in the monomial 3a2b is 3 and the coefficient in the monomial -2ab2 is -2.

So, the sum of the coefficients in the monomials 3a2b and -2ab2 = 3 + (-2) = 3 - 2 = 1

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

Which of the following pairs is/are like terms?

(a) 1, 2                               (b) 2, 3                               (c) 3, 4                              (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
Since, 3x3 and 4x3 is the pair of like terms.

Hence, the correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
The boys and girls in a school are in the ratio 8 : 5. If the number of girls is 160, what is the total strength of the school?

(a) 250
(b) 260
(c) 356
(d) 416
fields.solution_html:
(d) 416

Let x be the number of boys.

⇒85= x160 ⇒x=8×1605= 256∴ Total strength of the school =256 + 160 = 416

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

The improper fraction 2125 in decimal form is

fields.solution_html:
The given fraction is 2125. Now,

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

The sum of the values of the expression 2x2 + 2x + 2 when x = -1 and x = 1 is
​
(a) 6                                         (b) 8                                         (c) 4                                         (d) 2
fields.solution_html:
Since, when x = -1, the value of the expression 2x2 + 2x + 2 = 2(-1)2 + 2(-1) + 2 = 2 - 2 + 2 = 2

And, when x = 1, the value of the expression 2x2 + 2x + 2 = 2(1)2 + 2(1) + 2 = 2 + 2 + 2 = 6

So, the sum of the values of the expression 2x2 + 2x + 2 when x = -1 and x = 1 = 2 + 6 = 8

Hence, the correct alternative is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

How much is -2x2 + x + 1 less than x2 + 2x - 3?

(a) -x2 + 3x - 2                      (b) 3x2 + x - 4                      (c) -3x2 - x + 4                       (d) 3x2 + 3x - 4
fields.solution_html:
Since, (x2 + 2x - 3) - (-2x2 + x + 1) = x2 + 2x - 3 + 2x2 - x - 1 = 3x2 + x - 4

So, -2x2 + x + 1 is less than x2 + 2x - 3 by 3x2 + x - 4.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (b).

fields.question_html:

If a=3-3-33 and b=33-3-3, then ab-ba=a 0                                    b 1                                    c -1                                    d 2
fields.solution_html:
Since, a=3-3-33=133-33        As, x-m=1xm=127-271=127-27×271×27=127-72927=1-72927=-72827Also, b=33-3-3=33-133           As, x-m=1xm=271-127=27×271×27-127=72927-127=729-127=72827Now,ab-ba=-7282772827-72827-72827=-1--1=-1+1=0

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

What should be multiplied to 6-2 so that the product may be equal to 216?a 64                                    b 65                                    c 63                                    d 6
fields.solution_html:
Let 6m should be multiplied to 6-2.A.T.Q.6-2×6m=216⇒6-2+m=63Comparing th exponent of both the sides, we get-2+m=3⇒m=3+2∴ m=5

So, 65 should be multiplied.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

If 2x+53=14x+4, then x=a 3                                     b 4                                     c 34                                     d 43
fields.solution_html:
As, 2x+53=14x+4⇒2x-14x=4-53                By transposing 53 to RHS and 14x to LHS⇒2x1-x4=41-53⇒8x4-x4=123-53⇒8x-x4=12-53⇒7x4=73⇒7x×3=4×7                          By cross multiplication⇒21x=28⇒x=2821∴ x=43

Hence, the correct alternative is option (d).

fields.question_html:

The number 2.35 × 104 in the usual form is written as

Since, 2.35 × 104 =  2.35 × 10000 = 23500

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If 27-45 is expressed as a rational number with denominator 5, then the numerator is

(a) 3                                 (b) −3                                 (c) 6                                 (d) −6
fields.solution_html:
In order to express 27-45 as a rational number with denominator 5, firstly find a number which gives 5 when −45 is divided by it.

This number is −45 ÷ 5 = −9.

Dividing the numerator and denominator of 27-45 by −9, we have

27-45=27÷-9-45÷-9=-35

Thus, the numerator is −3.

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

The zero of 3x + 2 is

a 23                                     b 32                                     c -23                                     d -32
fields.solution_html:
If 3x+2=0, then3x=-2          Transposing +2 to RHS⇒x=-23

So, the zero of 3x + 2 is -23.

Note: A zero is that number, when put in place of the variable, makes the expression equal to zero.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

If x+2x-2=23, then x=a -10                                     b 10                                     c 43                                     d -43
fields.solution_html:
As, x+2x-2=23⇒3x+2=2x-2              By cross multiplication⇒3x+6=2x-4⇒3x-2x=-6+4               By transposing 2x to LHS and 6 to RHS∴ x=-10

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

Then, 9 : x :: x : 16

9 ×16 = x × x                 (Product of extremes =Product of means)⇒x2 = 144⇒x = 12

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

If 2x-32=5x+34, then x=a 34                                     b -34                                     c 43                                     d -43
fields.solution_html:
As, 2x-32=5x+34⇒2x-5x=32+34           By transposing -32 to RHS and 5x to LHS⇒-3x=64+34⇒-3x=6+34⇒x=94×-3                 By transposing -3 to RHS⇒x=34×-1⇒x=3-4∴ x=-34

Hence, the correct alternative is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

If x2-4=x3-1, then x=a 3                                     b 6                                     c 18                                     d 2
fields.solution_html:
As, x2-4=x3-1⇒x2-x3=4-1             By transposing x3 to LHS and -4 to RHS⇒3x6-2x6=3⇒3x-2x6=3⇒x6=3⇒x=3×6                    By transposing 6 to RHS∴ x=18

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

If x6+x4=x2+34, then x=a 9                                     b 6                                     c -9                                     d 4
fields.solution_html:
As, x6+x4=x2+34⇒x6+x4-x2=34           By transposing x2 to LHS⇒2x12+3x12-6x12=34⇒2x+3x-6x12=34⇒-x12=34⇒-x×4=3×12              By cross multiplication⇒-4x=36⇒x=36-4∴ x=-9

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

The sum of two consecutive odd numbers is 36. The larger number is

(a) 17                                  (b) 15                                  (c) 19                                  (d) 21
fields.solution_html:
Let the two consecutive odd numbers be x and x+2.As, the sum of the two consecutive odd numbers is 36.⇒x+x+2=36⇒2x+2=36⇒2x=36-2⇒2x=34⇒x=342⇒x=17∴ x+2=17+2=19

So, the larger number is 19.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

Twice a number when increased by 7 gives 25. The number is

(a) 7                                   (b) 9                                   (c) 10                                   (d) 8
fields.solution_html:
Let the number be x.As, twice the number when increased by 7 gives 25.⇒2x+7=25⇒2x=25-7          By transposing 7 to RHS⇒2x=18⇒x=182               By transposing 2 to RHS∴ x=9

So, the number is 9.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

The length of a rectangle is three times its width and its perimeter 56 m. The length is

(a) 7 m                               (b) 14 m                               (c) 21 m                               (d) 28 m
fields.solution_html:
Let the width of the rectangle be x. Then,the length of the rectangle=3xAs, perimeter of the rectangle=56 m⇒2×Length+Breadth=56⇒2×3x+x=56⇒2×4x=56⇒8x=56⇒x=568∴ x=7So, the length of the rectangle=3x=3×7=21 m

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
8 men can finish a piece of work in 40 days. If 2 more men join them, the work will be completed in

(a) 30 days
(b) 32 days
(c) 36 days
(d) 25 days
fields.solution_html:
8 men finish the work in 40 days.
1 man can finish the work in 8×40 days.                                                 [Less men, more days]
10 men can finish the work in 8×4010 = 32 days.                                      [More men, less days]
∴ If 2 more men join them, the work will be completed in 32 days.

The correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

Two complementary angles differ by 20°. The smaller angle is

(a) 55°                                    (b) 25°                                    (c) 65°                                    (d) 35°
fields.solution_html:
Let the smaller angle be x. Then,The larger angle=x+20°As, the sum of the two complementary angles is always 90°.⇒x+x+20°=90°⇒2x+20°=90°⇒2x=90°-20°⇒2x=70°⇒x=70°2                     By transposing 2 to RHS∴ x=35°

So, the smaller angle is 35°.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (d).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

Two supplementary angles differ by 40°. The measure of the larger angle is

(a) 70°                                     (b) 80°                                     (c) 110°                                     (d) 100°
fields.solution_html:
Let the larger angle be x. Then,The smaller angle=x-40°As, the sum of the two supplementary angles is always 180°.⇒x+x-40°=180°⇒2x-40°=180°⇒2x=180°+40°⇒2x=220°⇒x=220°2                     By transposing 2 to RHS∴ x=110°

So, the measure of the larger angle is 110°.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

23 of a number is less than the original number by 20. The number is

(a) 30                                  (b) 40                                  (c) 50                                  (d) 60
fields.solution_html:
Let the number be x.As, 23 of the number is less than the original number by 20.⇒x-23x=20⇒x1-2x3=20⇒3x3-2x3=20⇒3x-2x3=20⇒x3=20⇒x=20×3            By transposing 3 to RHS∴ x=60

So, the number is 60.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (d).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

A number is as much greater than 31 as it is less than 81. The number is

(a) 46                                   (b) 56                                   (c) 66                                   (d) 76
fields.solution_html:
Let the number be x.As, the number is as much greater than 31 as it is less than 81.⇒x-31=81-x⇒x+x=81+31            By transposing -x to LHS and -31 to RHS⇒2x=112⇒x=1122                     By transposing 2 to RHS∴ x=56

So, the number is 56.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

The sum of three consecutive odd numbers is 81. The middle number is

(a) 25                                     (b) 27                                     (c) 31                                     (d) 29
fields.solution_html:
Let the three consecutive odd numbers be x, x+2 and x+4.As, the sum of the three consecutive numbers is 81.⇒x+x+2+x+4=81⇒3x+6=81⇒3x=81-6               By transposing 6 to RHS⇒3x=75⇒x=753                     By transposing 3 to RHS⇒x=25∴ x+2=25+2=27

So, the middle number is 27.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (b).

fields.question_html:
If 2(2n + 5) = 3(3n - 10), then n =

(a) 5                                       (b) 3                                      (c) 7                                      (d) 8
fields.solution_html:
As, 22n+5=33n-10⇒4n+10=9n-30⇒4n-9n=-10-30             By transposing 10 to RHS and 9n to LHS⇒-5n=-40⇒n=-40-5                             By transposing -5 to RHS∴ n=8

Hence, the correct alternative is option (d).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

-102119 in standard form is

(a) -67                                 (b) 67                                 (c) -617                                 (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
The denominator of the rational number -102119 is positive.

In order to write the rational number in standard form, divide its numerator and denominator by the HCF of 102 and 119.

HCF of 102 and 119 = 17

Dividing the numerator and denominator of -102119 by 17, we have

-102119=-102÷17119÷17=-67

Thus, the standard form of -102119 is -67.

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

The sum of two consecutive whole numbers is 43. The smaller number is

(a) 21                                 (b) 22                                 (c) 23                                 (d) 24
fields.solution_html:
Let the two consecutive whole numbers be x and x+1.As, the sum of the two consecutive whole numbers is 43.⇒x+x+1=43⇒2x+1=43⇒2x=43-1              By transposing 1 to RHS⇒2x=42⇒x=422                    By transposing 2 to RHS∴ x=21

So, the smaller number is 21.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
10 pipes of the same diameter can fill a tank in 24 minutes. If 2 pipes go out of order, how long will the remaining pipe take to fill the tank?

(a) 40 min
(b) 45 min
(c) 30 min
(d) 1915 min
fields.solution_html:
Time taken to fill the tank by 10 pipes = 24 min
Time taken to fill the tank by 1 pipe = 24 ×10 min                       [Less pipes, more time taken]
Time taken to fill the tank by 8 pipes = 24×108 min = 30 min        [More pipes, less time taken]
Hence, it will take 30 minutes to fill the tank if two pipes go out of order.

The correct option is (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

A rational number equal to -23 is

(a) -1025                                 (b) 10-15                                 (c) -96                                 (d) None of these
fields.solution_html:
We know that two rational numbers are equal if they have the same standard form.

The rational number -23 is in its standard form.

Consider the rational number 10-15.

This rational number can be expressed in standard form as follows:

10-15=10×-1-15×-1=-1015                  (Multiplying numerator and denominator by −1 to make denominator positive)

HCF of 10 and 15 = 5

Dividing the numerator and denominator of -1015 by 5, we have

-1015=-10÷515÷5=-23

Thus, the standard form of -1015 is -23, which is same as the given rational number.

So, the rational number equal to -23 is 10-15.

Let us check why options (a) and (c) are not correct.

The standard form of -1025 is -25.

HCF of 10 and 25 = 5

Dividing the numerator and denominator of -1025 by 5, we have

-1025=-10÷525÷5=-25            

The standard form of -96 is -32.

HCF of 6 and 9 = 3

Dividing the numerator and denominator of -96 by 3, we have

-96=-9÷36÷2=-32            

Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

If a : b = 4 : 5 and b : c = 2 : 3, then a : c =

(a) 4 : 3                                (b) 8 : 15                                (c) 8 : 9                                (d) 5 : 3
fields.solution_html:
As, a:b=4:5⇒ab=45Also, b:c=2:3⇒bc=23So, a:c=ac=abbc=ab×bc=45×23=815=8:15

Hence, the correct alternative is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

Which of the following is correct?

(a) 59>-3-8                                 (b) 59<-3-8                                 (c) 2-3<-87                                 (d) 4-3>-87
fields.solution_html:
Consider the rational numbers 59 and -3-8.

We write the rational number -3-8 with positive denominator.
-3-8=-3×-1-8×-1=38

Now, we write the rational numbers so that they have a common denominator.

LCM of 8 and 9 = 72

So, 59=5×89×8=4072 and 38=3×98×9=2772

Now,

40>27⇒4072>2772⇒59>38⇒59>-3-8

It can also be checked that 2-3>-87 and 4-3<-87.

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

The whole number nearest to 457 and divisible by 11 is

(a) 450                                 (b) 451                                 (c) 460                                 (d) 462
fields.solution_html:
The numbers 450 and 460 are not divisible by 11.

Now, both the numbers 451 and 462 are divisible by 11.

Distance between 457 and 451 on the number line = 457 − 451 = 6

Distance between 457 and 462 on the number line = 462 − 457 = 5

Thus, the whole number nearest to 457 and divisible by 11 is 462.

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
A rope makes 140 rounds of the circumference of a cylinder, the radius of whose base is 14 cm. How many times can it go round a cylinder with radius 20 cm?

(a) 28
(b) 17
(c) 98
(d) 200
fields.solution_html:
(c) 98

No. of rounds around the cylinder of radius 14 cm = 140
No. of rounds around the cylinder of radius 1 cm = 140×14             [Less radius, more rounds]
No. of rounds around the cylinder of radius 20 cm = 140×1420 = 98      [More radius, less rounds]

Hence, the rope makes 98 rounds around the circumference of the cylinder of radius 20 cm.

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If -38 and x-24 are equivalent rational numbers, then x =

(a) 3                                 (b) 6                                 (c) 9                                 (d) 12
fields.solution_html:
It is given that the rational numbers -38 and x-24 are equivalent rational numbers.

We know that the values of two equivalent rational numbers is equal. 

∴x-24=-38⇒x×8=-3×-24                     ab=cd⇒ad=bc⇒8x=72⇒8x8=728                                   Dividing both sides by 8⇒x=9

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

What must be added to each term of the ratio 9 : 16 to make the ratio 2 : 3?

(a) 5                               (b) 3                               (c) 4                               (d) 6
fields.solution_html:
Let the number that must be added to each term of the ratio 9:16 be x. Then,9+x:16+x=2:3⇒9+x16+x=23⇒39+x=216+x⇒27+3x=32+2x⇒3x-2x=32-27∴ x=5

So, 5 must be added to each term of the ratio 9 : 16 to make the ratio 2 : 3.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

The present ages of Renu and Ravi are in the ratio 5 : 6. The sum of their present ages is 44 in years. The difference of their ages (in years) is

(a) 4                                          (b) 5                                          (c) 8                                          (d) 2
fields.solution_html:
Let the present ages of Renu and Ravi be 5x and 6x.As, the sum of their present ages=44 years⇒5x+6x=44⇒11x=44⇒x=4411∴ x=4Now, the present age of Renu=5×4=20 years andthe present ages of Ravi=6×4=24 yearsSo, the difference of their ages=24-20=4 years

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

(a) 400
(b) 450
(c) 500
(d) 600
fields.solution_html:
(c) 500
Let x be the maximum marks.
Pass marks = (160 + 20) = 180
∴ 36% of x = 180
⇒ 36100×x=180
⇒ x = 180×10036=5×100=500
Hence, maximum marks = 500

An ore contains 5% copper. How much ore is required to obtain 400 g of copper?

(a) 2 kg
(b) 4 kg
(c) 6 kg
(d) 8 kg
fields.solution_html:
(d) 8 kg
Let x kg be the required amount of ore.
Then, 5% of x kg = 400 g = 0.4 kg        [∵ 1 kg = 1000 g]
⇒ 5100×x=0.4
⇒ x = 0.4×1005 = 8
Hence, 8 kg of ore is required to obtain 400 g of copper.

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
A number increased by 20% gives 42. The number is

(a) 35
(b) 28
(c) 36
(d) 30
fields.solution_html:
(a) 35
Let the required number be x.
Then, x + 20% of x = 42
⇒ x+20x100=42
⇒ x+x5=42
⇒ 5x+x5=42        [∵ LCM of 1 and 5 = 5]
⇒ 6x5=42
∴ x = 42×56=35
Hence, the required number is 35.

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
After deducting a commission of 10% a TV costs Rs 18000. What is its gross value?

(a) Rs 18800
(b) Rs 20000
(c) Rs 19800
(d) none of these
fields.solution_html:
(b) Rs. 20000
Suppose that the gross value of the TV is Rs x.
Commission on the TV = 10%
Price of the TV after deducting the commission = Rs (x − 10% of x)
                                                                  = Rs x-10100x = Rs 100x-10x100 = Rs 9x10
However, price of the TV after deducting the commission = Rs 18000
Then, Rs 9x10 = Rs 18000
∴ x = 18000×109 = Rs (2000 × 10) = Rs 20000
Hence, the gross value of the TV is Rs 20,000

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
A fruit-seller had some apples. He sells 40% of them and still has 420 apples. How many apples had he in all?

(a) 588
(b) 600
(c) 700
(d) 725
fields.solution_html:
(c) 700
Suppose that the fruit seller initially had 100 apples.
Number of apples sold = 40
∴ Number of remaining apples = (100 − 40) = 60

Initial number of apples if 60 of them are remaining = 100
Initial number of apples if 420 of them are remaining = 10060×420 = 700
Hence, the fruit seller originally had 700 apples with him.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

(d) 840
fields.solution_html:
(c) 560
Suppose that the number of examinees is 100.
Number of passed examinees = 95
Number of failed examinees = (100 − 95) = 5

Total number of examinees if 5 of them failed = 100
Total number of examinees if 28 of them failed = 1005×28=20×28=560
Hence, there were 560 examinees.

fields.question_html:

(a) 20                                       (b) 25                                       (c) 101                                       (d) 29

Hence, the correct alternative is option (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in each of the following:

If the product of two non-zero rational numbers is 1, then they are

(a) additve inverse of each other                                 (b) multiplicative inverse of each other

(c) reciprocal of each other                                         (d) both (b) and (c)
fields.solution_html:
For every non-zero rational number ab there exists a rational number ba such that

ab×ba=1

Here, the rational number ba is called the multiplicative inverse or reciprocal of ab.

Thus, if the product of two non-zero rational numbers is 1, then they are multiplicative inverse or reciprocal of each other.

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.solution_html:
Let the cost price be Rs. x.
 Loss = Rs. x7

SP = Rs. 144

The correct answer is 12.5%.
All the given options are wrong.

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

If a, b and c are respectively the coefficients of x2 in -x2, 2x2 + x and 2x - x2, respectively, then a + b + c =

(a) 0                                         (b) -2                                         (c) 2                                         (d) -1
fields.solution_html:
As, the coefficient x2 in -x2 = -1, the coefficient x2 in 2x2 + x = 2 and the coefficient x2 in 2x - x2 = -1.

Now, a + b + c = (-1) + 2 + (-1) = -2 + 2 = 0

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

What should be added to 2.06 to get 3.1?

(a) 1.4
(b) 1.24
(c) 1.04
(d) none of these
fields.solution_html:
Option (c) is correct.
Let the number added be x.
We have:
2.06 + x = 3.1
⇒ x = 3.1 − 2.06

Converting the given decimals into like decimals, we get:
2.06 and 3.10
Thus, required number = (3.10 − 2.06) = 1.04

Hence, 1.04 should be added to 2.06 to get 3.1.

If x-23=2x-13-1, then x=a 2                                     b 4                                     c 6                                     d 8
fields.solution_html:
As, x-23=2x-13-1⇒x-23-2x-13=-1          By transposing 2x-13 to LHS⇒x-2-2x-13=-1⇒x-2-2x+13=-1⇒-x-13=-1⇒-x-1=-1×3                 By transposing 3 to RHS⇒-x-1=-3⇒-x=-3+1                       By transposing -1 to RHS⇒-x=-2∴ x=2

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
What should be subtracted from .1 to get .04?

(a) 0.6
(b) 0.06
(c) 0.006
(d) none of these
fields.solution_html:
(b) 0.06
We have:
0.1 − x  = 0.04
⇒ x = 0.1 − 0.04
Converting the given decimals into like decimals, we get:
0.10 and 0.04
Thus, required number = (0.10 − 0.04) = 0.06
Hence, 0.06 should be subtracted from 0.1 to get 0.04.

fields.question_html:
Silk threads threads are obtained from

(a) egg
(b) cocoon
(c) leaves
(d) larva
fields.solution_html:
(b) cocoon.
Silk threads are obtained by unravelling the cocoons of silkworms after they are boiled in water to kill the silkworm within the cocoon.

fields.solution_html:
As, a:b=3:4⇒ab=34So, 4a:3b=4a3b=43×ab=43×34=1212=11=1:1

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

fields.question_html:

fields.solution_html:
As, 2x=3y⇒xy=32And, 4y=5z⇒yz=54Now, x:z=xz=xyyz=xy×yz=32×54=158=15:8

Hence, the correct alternative is option (d).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

If p:q=2:5, then 25p+14q5p+7q=a 8:5                                b 5:8                                c 8:3                                d 3:8
fields.solution_html:
As, p:q=2:5⇒pq=25Let p=2x and q=5xNow, 25p+14q5p+7q=25×2x+14×5x5×2x+7×5x=50x+70x10x+35x=120x45x=83=8:3

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

fields.solution_html:
As, x:y=1:1⇒xy=11⇒x=yNow,3x+4y5x+6y=3x+4x5x+6x            As, x=y=7x11x=711

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

What per cent of 27 is 135?

(a) 25%
(b) 20%
(c) 15%
(d) 10%
fields.solution_html:
(d) 10%

Let x be the required percent.
Then, x % of 27 = 135
⇒ x100×27=135
∴ x = 100×735×2 = 10
Hence, 10% of 27 is 135

(b) 2.5%
(c) 3.6%
(d) 0.25%
fields.solution_html:
(b) 2.5%

Let x % of 1 day be 36 min.
Then, x100×1×24×60 min = 36 min
∴ x = 36×10024×60 = 3×52×3%=52%=2.5% 

Hence, 2.5% of 1 day is 36 min.

Mark (✓) against the correct answer
On increasing the salary of a man by 25%, it becomes Rs 20000. What was his original salary?

(a) Rs 15000
(b) Rs 16000
(c) Rs 18000
(d) Rs 25000
fields.solution_html:
(b) Rs. 16000
Let us assume that the original salary of the man is Rs x.
Increase in it = 25%
Value increased in the salary = 25% of Rs. x
                                               = Rs 25100×x = Rs x4
Salary after increment= Rs x+x4 = Rs 5x4
However, increased salary = Rs 20000
Then, Rs 5x4 = Rs 20000
∴  x = Rs 20000×45 = Rs 16000
Hence, the original salary of the man is Rs 16,000

fields.question_html:
Tick (✓) the correct answer
A circle has

(a) no line of symmetry
(b) one line of symmetry
(c) two lines of symmetry
(d) an unlimited number of lines of symmetry
fields.solution_html:
(d) an unlimited number of lines of symmetry

A circle is symmetrical about all its diameters and a circle has unlimited number of diameters.
Therefore, a circle has unlimited number of lines of symmetry.

fields.solution_html: (d) 52 cm In right angled isoceles triangle, right angled at C, AC is equal to BC and AB is the hypotenuse.           AB2=AC2+BC2                    =52+52                    =50          ∴ AB=2×25=52 cm

fields.solution_html: (b) 25 mIn right triangle ABC:      AC2=AB2+BC2              =152+202                 => AC2=625      =>AC=±25Since the length cannot be negative, we will negelect -25.∴ Length of the ladder = 25 m

fields.question_html:

Two poles of heights 6 m and 11 m stand vertically on a plane ground. If the distance between their feet is 12 m, what is the distance between their tops?

(a) 13 m
(b) 14 m
(c) 15 m
(d) 12.8 m
fields.solution_html: (a) 13 mSuppose there are two poles AE and BD.EC=AB=12 m      (ABCE is a rectangle)AE= BC= 6 m      (ABCE is a rectangle)DC= BD-AE      = 11-6   =5 mIn the right angled triangle ECD:ED2=EC2+DC2  (Pythagoras theorem)ED2=52+122ED2=25+144ED2=169ED=±13The length cannot be negative.∴ED=13 m

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
If 35% of a number added to 39 is the number itself, the number is

(a) 60
(b) 65
(c) 75
(d) 105
fields.solution_html:
(a) 60
Let x be the number.
According to question, we have:
(35% of x ) + 39 = x
⇒ 35100×x+39=x
⇒ 7x20+39=x
⇒ x-7x20=39
⇒ 20x-7x20=39
⇒ 13x20=39
∴ x = 39×2013 = 60
Hence, the required number is 60

Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

What least number is to be subtracted from each term of the ratio 15 : 19 to make the ratio 3 : 4?

(a) 3                                          (b) 5                                          (c) 6                                          (d) 9
fields.solution_html:
Let the least number that is to be subtracted from each term of the ratio 15:19 be x. Then,15-x:19-x=3:4⇒15-x19-x=34⇒415-x=319-x⇒60-4x=57-3x⇒3x-4x=57-60⇒-x=-3∴ x=3

So, 3 is the least number to be subtracted from each term of the ratio 15 : 19 to make the ratio 3 : 4.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

The ages of Ravish and Shikha are in the ratio 3 : 8. Six years hence, their ages will be in the ratio 4 : 9. The present age of Ravish is

(a) 18 years                                   (b) 15 years                                    (c) 12 years                                    (d) 21 years
fields.solution_html:
Let the present age of Ravish and Shikha be 3x and 8x, respectively.After six years,Age of Ravish=3x+6 years andAge of Shikha=8x+6 yearsSince, 3x+6:8x+6=4:9⇒3x+68x+6=49⇒93x+6=48x+6⇒27x+54=32x+24⇒27x-32x=24-54⇒-5x=-30⇒x=-30-5⇒x=6∴ 3x=3×6=18

So, the present age of Ravish is 18 years.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (a).

fields.question_html:
Mark the correct alternative in the following question:

If ₹840 is divided between P and Q in the ratio 3 : 4, then P's share is

(a) ₹340                                  (b) ₹480                                  (c) ₹360                                  (d) ₹400
fields.solution_html:
Let P's share be ₹x. Then,Q's share=₹840-xAs, P's share:Q's share=3:4⇒P's shareQ's share=34⇒x840-x=34⇒4x=3840-x⇒4x=3×840-3x⇒4x+3x=3×840⇒7x=3×840⇒x=3×8407⇒x=3×120∴ x=360

So, P's share is ₹360.

Hence, the correct alternative is option (c).

(b) 30%
(c) 1623%
(d) 3313%
fields.solution_html:
(d) 3313%

Let the cost price of each toffee be Rs. 1
Cost price of three toffees = Rs 3
SP of three toffees = CP of four toffees =  Rs 4

CP = Rs 3  
SP = Rs 4

Gain = SP - CP = Rs ( 4 - 3 ) = Re 1
Gain% = GainCP× 100% = 13× 100 %=1003% =3313%

fields.question_html:
The length of a rectangle is 16 cm and the length of its diagonal is 20 cm. The area of the rectangle is

(a) 320 cm2
(b) 160 cm2
(c) 192 cm2
(d) 156 cm2
fields.solution_html:
(c) 192 cm2

Let ABCD be the rectangular plot.
Then, AB = 16 cm
          AC = 20 cm

Let BC = x cm
From right triangle ABC:
AC2 = AB2 + BC2
⇒ (20)2 = (16)2 + x2
⇒ x2 = (20)2 - (16)2 ⇒ {400 - 256} = 144
⇒ x = 144 = 12
∴ BC = 12 cm
∴ Area of the plot = (16 × 12) cm2 = 192 cm2

fields.question_html:
On increasing each side of a square by 25% , the increase in area will be

(a) 25%
(b) 55%
(c) 40.5%
(d) 56.25%
fields.solution_html:
(d) 56.25%

Let the side of the square be a cm.
Area of the square = (a)2 cm2
Increased side = (a + 25% of a) cm
                        = a+25100a cm = a+14acm=54a cm
Area of the square = 54a2cm2=2516a2 cm2
Increase in the area = 2516a2-a2 cm2= 25a2-16a216 cm2 = 9a216 cm2
% increase in the area = Increased areaOld area×100
                              = 916a2a2×100 = 9×10016=56.25

fields.question_html:
The length of a rectangular field is thrice its breadth and its perimeter is 240 m. The length of the field is

(a) 80 m
(b) 120 m
(c) 90 m
(d) none of these
fields.solution_html:
(c) 90 m

Let the breadth of the rectangular field be x m.
Length = 3x m
Perimeter of the rectangular field = 2(l + b)
⇒ 240 = 2( x + 3x)
⇒ 240 = 2(4x)
⇒ 240 = 8x     ⇒ x = 2408=30
∴ Length of the field = 3x = (3 × 30) m = 90 m

fields.question_html:
