Gain% = 20

C.P. = {100(100 + Profit percentage)× S.P.} ={100120× 720} = 720012 = Rs. 600

fields.question_html:
How many metres of carpet 63 cm wide will be required to cover the floor of a room 14 m by 9 m?

(a) 200 m
(b) 210 m
(c) 220 m
(d) 185 m
fields.solution_html:
(a) 200 m

Area of the floor of a room = 14 m × 9 m = 126 m2

Width of the carpet = 63 cm = 0.63 m                (since 100 cm = 1 m)

∴ Required length of the carpet = Area of the floor of a roomWidth of the carpet
                                                = 1260.63 m=200 m

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
On selling a jug for Rs 168, a man loses 17 of his outlay. The cost price of the jug is

(a) Rs 144
(b) Rs 192
(c) Rs 196
(d) none of these
fields.solution_html:
(c) Rs. 196

Let the cost price of the jug be Rs. x.
Loss = Rs. x7
SP of the jug = CP - Loss
=Rs. ( x - x7) = Rs. 67x                                       
                                                                                    
​SP of the jug = Rs 168         (given)

∴   67x = 168 
⇒=168 × 76 ⇒x= 11766 ⇒x=196                    
   
∴ CP of the jug = Rs. 196
fields.options: ["(a) Rs 144", "(b) Rs 192", "(c) Rs 196", "(d) none of these"]

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
If the cost price of 5 bananas be equal to the selling price of 3 bananas, then gain per cent is

(a) 3313%
(b) 15%
(c) 6623%
(d) 40%
fields.solution_html:
(c) 6623%

Let the cost price of each banana be Re 1.
Cost price of three bananas = Rs. 3
SP of three bananas = CP of five bananas = Rs. 5
Gain = SP - CP =  Rs. ( 5 - 3 ) = Rs. 2     
                                                        
 Gain% = GainCP× 100% = 23× 100% = 2003 %= 6623%

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
70% of students in a school are boys. If the number of girls is 240, how many boys are there in the school?

(a) 420
(b) 560
(c) 630
(d) 480
fields.solution_html:
(b) 560

Let the total number of students be 100.
Then, number of boys = 70
∴ Number of girls = (100 − 70) = 30

Now, total number of students if there are 30 girls = 100
Total number of students if there are 240 girls = 10030×240=800
∴ Number of boys = (800 − 240) = 560

Hence, there are 560 boys in the school.

fields.question_html:
The length of a room is 15 m. The cost of carpeting it with a carpet 75 cm wide at Rs 50 per metre is Rs 6000. The width of the room is

(a) 6 m
(b) 8 m
(c) 13.4 m
(d) 18 m
fields.solution_html:
(a) 6 m

Total cost of carpeting = Rs 6000
Rate of carpeting = Rs 50 per m
∴ Length of the carpet = 600050 m = 120 m
∴ Area of the carpet = 120×75100 m2 =  90 m2     [since 75 cm = 75100 m]
Area of the floor = Area of the carpet = 90 m2
∴ Width of the room = AreaLength=9015 m=6 m

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
Which one of the following is the correct statement?

(a) 23<35<1415
(b) 35<23<1415
(c) 1415<35<23
(d) none of these
fields.solution_html:
(b) 35<23<1415

The given fractions are 35, 23 and1415.

LCM of 5, 3 and 15 = 15

Now, we have:

23×55=1015, 35×33=915 and 1415×11=1415

Clearly, 915 <1015<1415

∴ 35<23<1415

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
The area of a circle is 154 cm2. Its diameter is

(a) 14 cm
(b) 11 cm
(c) 7 cm
(d) 22 cm
fields.solution_html:
(a) 14 cm

Let the radius of the circle be r cm.
Then, its area will be πr2 cm2.
∴ πr2 = 154
⇒ 227×r×r = 154
⇒ r2 = 154×722 = 49
⇒ r = 49 = 7 cm
∴ Diameter of the circle = 2r = (2 × 7) cm = 14 cm

(a) 45
(b) -54
(c) -45
(d) none of these
fields.solution_html:
(c) -45
Let the required number be x.
(−8)-1 x x = (10)-1
⇒ 1-8×x=110
∴ x = 110×(-8) = -45
Hence, the required number is -45.

fields.solution_html:

Let the radius of the circle be r cm.
Circumference = 2πrcm

∴ Area of the circle = πr2
                                 = 227×7×7 cm2 = 154 cm2

(a) 7%
(b) 8%
(c) 9%
(d) 12%
fields.solution_html:
(c) 9%
Let the sum be Rs x.           A=49x40We know:A=P+S.I.∴S.I. =A−P       =(49x40−x)       =49x−40x40       =9x40 Let the rate be R% per annum.                    S.I.=P×R×T100=>9x40=x×R×5110020×2=>R=9×201×214021=>R=9

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
8 men can finish a piece of work in 40 days. If 2 more men join them, the work will be completed in

(a) 30 days
(b) 32 days
(c) 36 days
(d) 25 days
fields.solution_html:
8 men finish the work in 40 days.
1 man can finish the work in 8×40 days.                                                 [Less men, more days]
10 men can finish the work in 8×4010 = 32 days.                                      [More men, less days]
∴ If 2 more men join them, the work will be completed in 32 days.

The correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:

(a) 1023 days
(b) 24 days
(c) 25 days
(d) 3712 days
fields.solution_html:
Number of days taken to reap the field by 16 men = 30 days
Number of days taken to reap the field by 1 man = 30×16 days                            [Less men, more days]
Number of days taken to reap the field by 20 men = 30×1620 = 24 days                [More men, less days]

Hence, 20 men will take 24 days to reap the field.

The correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
The ages of A and B are in the ratio 3 : 8. Six years hence, their ages will be in the ratio 4 : 9. The present age of A is

(a) 18 years
(b) 15 years
(c) 12 years
(d) 21 years
fields.solution_html:
(a)  18 years

Suppose that the present ages of A and B are 3x yrs and 8x yrs, respectively.
After six years, the age of A will be (3x+6) yrs and that of B will be (8x+6) yrs.
Then, (3x +6) : (8x + 6) = 4 : 9

⇒3x + 68x+6= 49⇒27x + 54 = 32x + 24⇒5x = 30⇒x = 6Hence, the present ages of A and B are 18 yrs and 48 yrs, respectively.

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
The ages of A and B are in the ratio 5 : 2. After 5 years, their ages will be in the ratio 15 : 7. The present age of A is

(a) 48 years
(b) 36 years
(c) 40 years
(d) 35 years
fields.solution_html:
(c) 40 years

Suppose that the present ages of A and B are 5x yrs and 2x yrs, respectively.
After 5 years, the ages of A and B will be (5x+5) yrs and (2x+5) yrs, respectively.

Then, (5x + 5) : (2x + 5) = 15 : 7

⇒ 5x+52x +5=157

Cross multiplying, we get:

35x + 35 = 30x + 75
⇒ 5x = 40
⇒ x = 8

Hence, the present age of A is 5 × 8 = 40 yrs.

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
If 16 men can reap a field in 30 days, in how many days will 20 men reap the same field?

(a) 24 days
(b) 25 days
(c) 1023 days
(d) 3712 days
fields.solution_html:
(a) 24 days

16 men can reap the field in 30 days.             
1 man can reap the field in 30×16 days.                        [Less men, more days]
∴ 20 men can reap the field in 30×1620 = 24 days            [More men, less days]

fields.question_html:
Mark (✓) against the correct answer
A garrison of 500 men had provisions for 27 days. After 3 days, a reinforcement of 300 men arrived. The remaining food will now last for how many days?

(a) 15 days
(b) 16 days
(c) 1712 days
(d) 18 days
fields.solution_html:
500 men had enough food for 24 days.
1 man had enough food for 24×500 days.                          [Less men, more days]
800 men had enough food for 24×500800 = 15 days             [More men , less days]

Hence, the food will now last for 15 days after the reinforcement of 300 men.

The correct option is (a).

fields.solution_html:
(b) 75 m

Height of the tree that casts a 4 m long shadow = 6 m
Height of the tree that casts a 1 m long shadow = 64  m
∴ Height of the flag pole that casts a 50 m long shadow = 64×50 = 75 m

fields.question_html:
If 35% of a number added to 39 is the number itself, the number is

(a) 60
(b) 65
(c) 75
(d) 105
fields.solution_html:
Let the required number be x.

According to the question,
35% of x+39=x⇒35100×x+39=x⇒35x×100100=x-39×100⇒35x=100x-3900⇒100x-35x=3900⇒65x=3900⇒x=390065⇒x=60

Hence, the correct option is (a).

fields.question_html:
The sum of an angle and one third of its supplementary angle is 90°. The measure of the angle is
(a) 135°
(b) 120°
(c) 60°
(d) 45°
fields.solution_html:
Let the required angle be x.
Now, supplementary of the required angle = 180∘ − x
Then,
x+13180°-x=90°⇒3x+180°-x=270°⇒2x=90°⇒x=45°
Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.question_html:
The measure of an angle which is its own complement is
(a) 30°
(b) 60°
(c) 90°
(d) 45°
fields.solution_html:
Let the required angle be x.
Now, complementary of the required angle = 90∘ − x
Then,
x=90°-x⇒x=90°-x⇒2x=90°⇒x=45°
Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

fields.question_html:
Two supplementary angles are in the ratio 3 : 2. The smaller angle measures
(a) 108°
(b) 81°
(c) 72°
(d) 68°
fields.solution_html:
Let the angles be 3x and 2x.
Now, 3x + 2x = 180∘
⇒ 5x = 180∘
⇒ x = 36∘ 
∴ Smaller angle = 2x = 2 × 36∘ = 72∘ 
Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

fields.question_html:

⇒ 2x + 6 = 136

fields.question_html:

fields.question_html:
If a sum of ₹2000 is lent out at 2% per annum for 10 years under simple interest, then the amount is

(a) ₹1400
(b) ₹2400
(c) ₹200
(d) ₹1500
fields.solution_html:
It is given that,
Sum (P) = ₹2000
Rate (R) = 2%
Time (T) = 10 years

I=P×R×T100   =2000×2×10100   =400

Amount = I + P = ₹400 + ₹2000 = ₹2400

Hence, the correct option is (b).

fields.question_html:

(b) 52°
(c) 142°
(d) 38°
fields.solution_html:
∠AOD + ∠DOB + ∠BOC = 180∘             [∵ AOC is a straight line]
⇒ 38∘ + x + 90∘ = 180∘
⇒ x + 128∘ = 180∘
⇒ x = 52∘
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
In Fig. 99, AB || CD and EF is a transversal intersecting ABand CO at Pand Q respectively. The measure of  ∠DPQ is
(a) 100∘
(b) 80∘
(c) 110∘
(d) 70∘
fields.solution_html:
∠BQF = ∠AQP = (4x)∘             [Vertically opposite angles]
Since, AB || CD
∴ ∠AQP + ∠CPQ = 180∘         [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ (4x)∘ + (5x)∘ = 180∘
⇒ 9x  = 180
⇒ x = 20
∴ ∠BQF = (4 × 20)∘ = 80∘
 Now, ∠BQF = ∠DPQ = 80∘          [Corresponding angles]
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

fields.question_html:
In Fig. 106, the value of x is
(a) 22
(b) 20
(c) 21
(d) 24
fields.solution_html:
(8x − 41)∘ + (3x)∘ + (3x + 10)∘ + (4x − 5)∘= 360∘
⇒ 8x − 41 + 3x + 3x + 10 + 4x − 5 = 360
⇒ 18x − 36 = 360
⇒ 18x = 396
⇒ x = 22
Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

fields.question_html:
In Fig. 110, if AB || CD. The value of x is
(a) 122
(b) 238
(c) 58
(d) 119
fields.solution_html:
Construction: Draw a line PQ parallel to AB which is also parallel to CD
Since, PQ || CD
∴ ∠EFC = ∠FEQ = 37∘                 [Alternate angles]
Now, ∠AEQ + ∠FEQ = ∠AEF    
⇒ ∠AEQ + 37∘ = 95∘
⇒ ∠AEQ = 58∘
Since, PQ || AB
∴∠EAB + ∠AEQ = 180∘                 [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ ∠EAB + 58∘ = 180∘
⇒ ∠EAB = 122∘
∠EAB + Reflex∠EAB = 360∘              [Complete angle]
∴ 122∘ + (2x)∘ = 360∘
⇒ 2x = 238
⇒ x = 119
Hence, the correct answer is option (d).
